edu.gatech.team4180.dsp

Class SpeechFeatures

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.team4180.dsp.SpeechFeatures

  • public class SpeechFeatures
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents features of a speech signal

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_FFT_SIZE
      Default FFT window size in samples: 256
      static int DEFAULT_FS
      Default sampling frequency in Hz: 10000
      static int DEFAULT_WIND_SHIFT
      Default FFT window shift length in samples: 100
      static double MIN_FEAT_DIST
      Default minimum distance required for a match of features: 2.0
      static int NUM_FEATURES
      Default number of features to extract from a signal: 13

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpeechFeatures(double[] saved_array)
      Constructor: builds features from a previously-stored array containing metadata + features
      SpeechFeatures(double[] signal, int fs, int fft_size, int wind_shift)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean compare(SpeechFeatures other)
      Compares these features to another set of features using the default distance threshold (MIN_FEAT_DIST)
      boolean compare(SpeechFeatures other, double threshold)
      Compares these features to another set of features given a distance threshold
      double[][] getFeatureArray()
      Generate the features of the speech signal in a 2-D array form
      Matrix getFeatures()
      Generate the features of the speech signal
      double[][] toArray()
      Return the features as 2-D array
      double[] toStorableArray()
      Return the features as a 1-D array prepended with metadata (sampling freq, fft_size, and wind_shift, dimension of each feature vector, count of feature vectors)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpeechFeatures

        public SpeechFeatures(double[] signal,
                      int fs,
                      int fft_size,
                      int wind_shift)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        signal - the speech signal
        fs - sampling frequency of the speech signal
        fft_size - window size (in samples) to use for signal processing
        wind_shift - shift size (in samples) by which the FFT window will move
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - signal cannot be null

      • SpeechFeatures

        public SpeechFeatures(double[] saved_array)
        Constructor: builds features from a previously-stored array containing metadata + features
        Parameters:
        saved_array - the previously-saved feature array
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - invalid feature array
        java.lang.RuntimeException - size-corrupted feature array

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public boolean compare(SpeechFeatures other,
                       double threshold)
        Compares these features to another set of features given a distance threshold
        Parameters:
        other - the other set of features
        threshold - the min distance required for matching
        Returns:
        true/false if match/mismatch
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - cannot compare to a null feature-set

      • compare

        public boolean compare(SpeechFeatures other)
        Compares these features to another set of features using the default distance threshold (MIN_FEAT_DIST)
        Parameters:
        other - the other set of features
        Returns:
        true/false if match/mismatch
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - cannot compare to a null feature-set

      • toArray

        public double[][] toArray()
        Return the features as 2-D array
        Returns:
        the features of the signal as a 2-D array

      • toStorableArray

        public double[] toStorableArray()
        Return the features as a 1-D array prepended with metadata (sampling freq, fft_size, and wind_shift, dimension of each feature vector, count of feature vectors)
        Returns:
        the features of the signal as a 2-D array

      • getFeatures

        public Matrix getFeatures()
        Generate the features of the speech signal
        Returns:
        computed features in a matrix form

      • getFeatureArray

        public double[][] getFeatureArray()
        Generate the features of the speech signal in a 2-D array form
        Returns:
        computed features in a 2-D array form
